        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2017/03/09/atom-1-15.html">Atom 1.15</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> March 9, 2017 <a href="https://github.com/andreagriffiths11" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/andreagriffiths11?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="andreagriffiths11" srcset="https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/andreagriffiths11?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/andreagriffiths11?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/andreagriffiths11?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/andreagriffiths11?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> andreagriffiths11</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p><img src="/img/posts/release-1-15.png" alt="Atom 1.15"></p>

<p>It was a quiet month because most of the team is toiling away on cool stuff thats not yet shipping. But we do have a few goodies hitting <a href="https://atom.io">Atom 1.15</a>.</p>


            <a href="/2017/03/09/atom-1-15.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2017/02/08/atom-1-14.html">Atom 1.14</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> February 8, 2017 <a href="https://github.com/iolsen" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="iolsen" srcset="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> iolsen</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p><img src="/img/posts/release-1-14.png" alt="Atom 1.14"></p>

<p><a href="https://atom.io">Atom 1.14</a> has shipped today with improved large file performance, a 64-bit Windows installation, improved MRU tab traversal, and more.</p>


            <a href="/2017/02/08/atom-1-14.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2017/01/18/atom-on-windows.html">Atom on Windows</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> January 18, 2017 <a href="https://github.com/damieng" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/damieng?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="damieng" srcset="https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/damieng?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/damieng?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/damieng?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/damieng?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> damieng</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p>Last year I joined the Atom team with the goal of making Atom a better experience on Windows and thought it would be worth highlighting some of our work so far as well as a few of the things new in Atom 1.14 (currently in beta).</p>

<p>If you havent tried Atom on Windows in a while or were just plain heads-down on your projects heres some Windows-specific improvements you may have missed.</p>


            <a href="/2017/01/18/atom-on-windows.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2017/01/10/atom-1-13.html">Atom 1.13</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> January 10, 2017 <a href="https://github.com/iolsen" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="iolsen" srcset="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> iolsen</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p><img src="/img/posts/release-1-13.png" alt="Atom 1.13"></p>

<p><a href="https://atom.io">Atom 1.13</a> has shipped today with benchmarks, reopen project, new Octicons and a keystroke resolver API. It ships <em>without</em> the Shadow DOM editor boundary.</p>


            <a href="/2017/01/10/atom-1-13.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2016/11/14/removing-shadow-dom-boundary-from-text-editor-elements.html">Removing Shadow DOM boundaries from text editor elements</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> November 14, 2016 <a href="https://github.com/as-cii" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/as-cii?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="as-cii" srcset="https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/as-cii?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/as-cii?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/as-cii?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/as-cii?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> as-cii</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p>We recently released Atom 1.13 Beta and it features a foundational change to the editor rendering internals that we would like to share with you: the removal of the Shadow DOM boundary from <code class="highlighter-rouge">&lt;atom-text-editor&gt;</code> elements. In this blog post we are going to shed some light on the reasons that drove its introduction, as well as why we eventually decided to transition away from it and employ a different technique instead.</p>

<p><img src="/img/posts/shadow-dom.png" alt="Shadow DOM"></p>


            <a href="/2016/11/14/removing-shadow-dom-boundary-from-text-editor-elements.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2016/11/09/atom-1-12.html">Atom 1.12</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> November 9, 2016 <a href="https://github.com/iolsen" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="iolsen" srcset="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> iolsen</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p><img src="/img/posts/release-1-12.png" alt="Atom 1.12"></p>

<p><a href="https://atom.io">Atom 1.12</a> has shipped today with another helping of fixes and improvements.</p>


            <a href="/2016/11/09/atom-1-12.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2016/10/17/the-wonderful-world-of-keyboards.html">The Wonderful World of Keyboards</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> October 17, 2016 <a href="https://github.com/nathansobo" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="nathansobo" srcset="https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> nathansobo</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p>With the beta release of Atom 1.12, were rolling out some long-awaited improvements to Atoms support for international keyboard layouts. Before 1.12, users on many layouts needed to install a community-maintained package called <a href="https://atom.io/packages/keyboard-localization"><code class="highlighter-rouge">keyboard-localization</code></a> to enable full support for their keyboards, but now users from all locales should experience hassle free keyboarding in Atoms default configuration. In this post, well discuss the challenges we faced recognizing keybindings and how we arrived at a solution.</p>

<p><img src="/img/posts/world-of-keyboards.png" alt="Keybord Graphic"></p>


            <a href="/2016/10/17/the-wonderful-world-of-keyboards.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2016/10/11/atom-1-11.html">Atom 1.11</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> October 11, 2016 <a href="https://github.com/iolsen" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="iolsen" srcset="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/iolsen?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> iolsen</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p><img src="/img/posts/release-1-11.png" alt="Atom 1.11"></p>

<p><a href="https://atom.io">Atom 1.11</a> features performance and stability improvements and, in particular, were excited that Atom now asks for permission before sending any telemetry data. <img class="emoji" title=":boom:" alt=":boom:" src="https://assets-cdn.github.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f4a5.png" height="20" width="20" align="absmiddle"></p>


            <a href="/2016/10/11/atom-1-11.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2016/08/31/atom-1-10-and-1-11-beta.html">Atom 1.10 and 1.11 beta</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> August 31, 2016 <a href="https://github.com/lee-dohm" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/lee-dohm?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="lee-dohm" srcset="https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/lee-dohm?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/lee-dohm?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/lee-dohm?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/lee-dohm?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> lee-dohm</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p>Hot on the heels of the last release, weve released <a href="https://atom.io">Atom v1.10</a> and <a href="https://atom.io/beta">v1.11-beta</a>!</p>


            <a href="/2016/08/31/atom-1-10-and-1-11-beta.html">Read more <span class="octicon octicon-chevron-right"></span></a>
          </div>
        </li>
      
    
      
        
        <li class="post">
          <h2 class="post-name"><a href="/2016/08/01/atom-1-9-and-1-10-beta.html">Atom 1.9 and 1.10 beta</a></h2>
          <p class="who-when"><span class="octicon octicon-calendar"></span> August 1, 2016 <a href="https://github.com/nathansobo" class="author-link"><img class="avatar avatar-small" src="https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=18" alt="nathansobo" srcset="https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=18 1x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=36 2x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=54 3x, https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/nathansobo?v=3&amp;s=72 4x" width="18" height="18" data-proofer-ignore="true"> nathansobo</a></p>
          <div class="post markdown">
            <p>Its that time again <a href="https://atom.io">Atom 1.9</a> and <a href="https://atom.io/beta">1.10-beta</a> are out!</p>

<body>
  

  <div class="footer-push">
    <div class="top-bar">
  <div class="wrapper no-pad">

    <ul class="navigation">
      
      <li><a class="" href="/packages">Packages</a></li>
      <li><a class="" href="/themes">Themes</a></li>
      <li><a class="" href="/docs">Documentation</a></li>
      <li><a href="http://blog.atom.io">Blog</a></li>
      <li><a href="http://discuss.atom.io">Discuss</a></li>
    </ul>

    <div class="top-bar-right">
        <a href="/login?last_url=%2F">
          <span class="octicon octicon-log-in"></span> Sign in
        </a>
    </div>
  </div>

    <div id="js-pjax-container">
      

<div class="welcome">
  <div class="call-to-action">
    <div class="wrapper">

      <div class="columns">
        <div class="column left">
          <header class="header">
    <h1 title="Atom: A hackable text editor for the 21st Century">
      <a href="/" class="logo"></a>
    </h1>
    <h2>A hackable text editor <span class="subtitle">for the 21st Century</span></h2>
</header>


            <a href="/download/windows_x64" class="download-button js-download-button">
              <span class="octicon octicon-move-down"></span>Download Windows 64-bit Installer
            </a>
            <span class="version-support">
              For Windows 7 64-bit or later.
              <a href="https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/latest">Other platforms</a> -
              <a href="/beta">Beta releases</a>
            </span>

        </div>

        <div class="column right">
          <div class="video">
            <button class="video-button js-video-button"></button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="wrapper no-pad">
      <span class="screenshot-main"></span>
    </div>

    <div class="video-modal">
      <button class="video-close-button js-video-close-button"></button>
    </div>

  </div>

  <div class="wrapper welcome-blurb">
  <p>Atom is a text editor that's modern, approachable, yet hackable to the
    corea tool you can customize to do anything but also use productively
    without ever touching a config file.</p>
</div>


  <div class="highlight">
  <h3>Full-featured, right out of the box</h3>

  <div class="wrapper features">
    <div class="one-o-feature">
      <div class="feature-circle">
        <span class="mega-octicon octicon-device-desktop"></span>
      </div>
      <h4>Cross-platform editing</h4>
      <p>Atom works across operating systems. You can use it on OS X, Windows, or Linux.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="one-o-feature">
      <div class="feature-circle">
        <span class="mega-octicon octicon-package"></span>
      </div>
      <h4>Built-in package manager</h4>
      <p>Search for and install new packages or start creating your ownall from within Atom.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="one-o-feature">
      <div class="feature-circle">
        <span class="mega-octicon octicon-light-bulb"></span>
      </div>
      <h4>Smart autocompletion</h4>
      <p>Atom helps you write code faster with a smart, flexible autocomplete.</p>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div class="wrapper features">
    <div class="one-o-feature">
      <div class="feature-circle">
        <span class="mega-octicon octicon-file-code"></span>
      </div>
      <h4>File system browser</h4>
      <p>Easily browse and open a single file, a whole project, or multiple projects in one window.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="one-o-feature">
      <div class="feature-circle">
        <span class="mega-octicon octicon-mirror"></span>
      </div>
      <h4>Multiple panes</h4>
      <p>Split your Atom interface into multiple panes to compare and edit code across files.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="one-o-feature">
      <div class="feature-circle">
        <span class="mega-octicon octicon-search"></span>
      </div>
      <h4>Find and replace</h4>
      <p>Find, preview, and replace text as you type in a file or across all your projects.</p>
    </div>
  </div>

</div>


  <div class="wrapper no-pad">
    <div class="why-its-rad">

      <div class="feature columns">
        <div class="column left markdown-body">
          <h3>Packages</h3>
<p>You choose from thousands of <a href="https://atom.io/packages">open source packages</a> that add new features and functionality to Atomor build a package from scratch and publish it for everyone else to use.</p>

        </div>
        <div class="column right">
          <span class="illustration illustration-packages"></span>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- end feature -->

      <div class="feature columns">
        <div class="column left markdown-body">
          <div class="demo">
            <span class="screen"></span>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="column right">
          <h3>Themes</h3>
<p>Atom comes pre-installed with four UI and eight syntax <a href="https://atom.io/themes">themes</a> in both dark and light colors. If you can't find what you're looking for, you can also install themes created by the Atom community or create your own.</p>

        </div>
      </div> <!-- end feature -->

      <div class="feature columns">
        <div class="column left markdown-body">
          <h3>Customization</h3>
<p>It's easy to customize and style Atom. You can tweak the look and feel of your UI with CSS/Less and add major features with HTML and JavaScript. Check out the video on <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U5POoGSrtGg" target="_blank">setting up Atom</a>. </p>

        </div>
        <div class="column right">
          <span class="illustration illustration-under-the-hood"></span>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- end feature -->

      <div class="feature columns">
        <div class="column left markdown-body">
          <div class="screenshot-native-web"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="column right">
          <h3>Under the hood</h3>
<p>Atom is a desktop application built with HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and Node.js integration. It runs on <a href="http://electron.atom.io/">Electron</a>, a framework for building cross platform apps using web technologies.</p>

        </div>
      </div> <!-- end feature -->

      <div class="feature columns">
        <div class="column left markdown-body">
          <h3>Open source</h3>
<p>Atom is open source. If you'd like to be part of the Atom community or help improve your favorite text editor, find us on <a href="https://github.com/atom/atom">GitHub</a>, <a href="http://discuss.atom.io/">Discuss</a> and <a href="http://atom-slack.herokuapp.com/">Slack</a>.</p>

        </div>
        <div class="column right">
          <div class="screenshot-open-source"></div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- end feature -->
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

  <div class="wrapper no-pad">
    <div class="feature columns">
      <div class="column left">
        <span class="illustration illustration-contact"></span>

    </div>

              <section class="sec-related-websites">
                <div class="page-header">
                  <h2>Related websites</h2>
                </div>
                <div class="list-group">
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="http://planet.plone.org" title="http://planet.plone.org">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">Planet Plone</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">This site aggregates Plone-related blogs from around the web.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="https://ploneconf.org" title="https://ploneconf.org">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">Plone Conference</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">The annual Plone conference is held in cities around the world and includes training classes, keynotes, presentations, demos, and sprints. Videos and slides are posted to the conference web site.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="http://jenkins.plone.org" title="http://jenkins.plone.org">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">jenkins.plone.org</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">The Plone community adheres to extensive testing while developing software, and uses Continuous Integration. Here you can find the latest test runs, managed by Jenkins.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="http://github.com/plone" title="http://github.com/plone">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">Plone on GitHub</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">Plone is fully open source, and is free software under the GPLv2. On GitHub.com, you can find the many repositories that make up the Plone project, ranging from the core software itself to the documentation sources.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="https://plone.org/security/hotfixes" title="https://plone.org/security/hotfixes">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">Available hotfixes</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">There may be hotfixes applicable to your version of Plone. Always check the Plone Hotfix Page before production deployment.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="http://plone.com" title="http://plone.com">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">Plone.com</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">A high-level introduction to Plone and its features, for those new to Plone.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="http://docs.plone.org" title="http://docs.plone.org">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">docs.plone.org</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">Community-maintained manual for the Plone content management system.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="https://community.plone.org" title="https://community.plone.org">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">Forum (community.plone.org)</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">The central place for discussions, questions and community communication.</p>
                  </a>
                  <a class="list-group-item" href="http://training.plone.org" title="http://training.plone.org">
                    <h4 class="list-group-item-heading">training.plone.org</h4>
                    <p class="list-group-item-text">The curriculum used for Plone training classes, including tutorials and walk-through examples; very useful as a self-guided learning resource.</p>
                  </a>
                </div>
              </section>

            </div>
          </div>

                        <div class="panel-body">
                          
                          <h3>2017 World Plone Day Munich, Germany</h3>
                          <p>Universität München, Oettingenstraße 67, Raum L 155 (1. Stock)</p>
                        </div>
                      </article>
                      </a>
                    </div>

                  
                    <div class="col-md-12 visible-md visible-lg"></div>

                  


                </div>
              </div>

            </div>

          </div>
        </section>


        <section class="sec-github-totals">
          <div class="container">
            <div class="page-header">
              <h2>
                <a href="/ploneorg/Members">
                  Community activity (last month)
                </a>
                <a href="https://pypi.python.org/pypi?:action=browse&amp;show=all&amp;c=518" class="btn btn-sm btn-default">
                  <span class="fa fa-star"></span>
                  PyPI
                </a>
                <a href="https://github.com/plone" class="btn btn-sm btn-default">
                  <span class="fa fa-github-alt"></span>
                  Plone
                </a>
                <a href="https://github.com/collective" class="btn btn-sm btn-default">
                  <span class="fa fa-github-alt"></span>
                  Collective
                </a>
              </h2>
            </div>
            
<p class="lead">There are many community activities that are not reflected in these numbers; after all, Plone thrives mostly because of the community talking. And we are still working on the scripts that aggregate these from a variety of sources, so for now take any number here with a very generous helping of salt.</p>

                <h4 class="modal-title" id="myModalLabel">Login via GitHub</h4>
              </div>
              <div class="modal-body">
                <p class="lead">To log in to this site, you will need a GitHub account. After logging in for the first
                 time, please edit your profile information to activate your account.</p>
                <p class="lead"><strong>Why:</strong> The Plone documentation, codebase, marketing and other tasks are 
                 managed through GitHub. Using the same login here makes it easier to coordinate team assignments.</p>
                <p class="lead"><strong>Note:</strong> You do <strong>not</strong> need to login to this site to ask
                 questions or make suggestions. For that you can participate at 
                 <a href="https://community.plone.org">community.plone.org</a> which provides a variety of login options.</p>

<div id="portlets-below" class="row">

     
         
             <div class="cell BelowTitlePortletManager1 width-full position-0">


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f775469746c65506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a7768792d7573652d706c6f6e65" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f775469746c65506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a7768792d7573652d706c6f6e65"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-why-use-plone"><p><img src="https://plone.com/images/1.png" alt="icon for Why Use Plone" class="image-inline" title="" /></p>
<h2><span class="title">Why Use Plone</span></h2>
<p class=" "><span class="title">Plone has an <a class="external-link" href="https://plone.org/" target="_blank" title="">active, thriving community</a> that holds <a class="external-link" href="https://plone.org/events" target="_blank" title="">annual conferences, regional symposia, and many sprints</a> all over the world.</span></p>
<p class=" "><em><span class="title"><strong>See <a class="external-link" href="https://plone.org/news/plones-outstanding-security-track-record" target="_blank" title="">Plone's statement about its outstanding security track record</a></strong> and the recent security hoax.</span></em></p>
<p class=" "><span class="title">The <a class="external-link" href="https://ploneconf.org" target="_blank" title="Plone Conference 2016">Plone Digital Experience 2016 Conference</a> was held in beautiful Boston, Massachusetts, USA, on October 17-23, 2016, at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and the Microsoft New England Research and Development Center. It included <a class="external-link" href="https://2016.ploneconf.org/training" target="_blank" title="">outstanding training classes</a> and mind-expanding <a class="external-link" href="https://2016.ploneconf.org/talks" target="_blank" title="">keynotes and talks</a>. Videos and slide decks are now posted, and the <a class="external-link" href="http://training.plone.org" target="_blank" title="">Plone training site</a> has been updated with those new materials. <a class="external-link" href="https://plone.org/news/photos/plone-conference-2017-coming-to-barcelona" target="_blank" title="">Plone Conference 2017 will be held in Barcelona</a>!</span></p>
<p class=" "><span class="title"><a class="external-link" href="https://ploneconf.org" target="_blank" title=""><img src="https://plone.com/lDmV8uWf.jpg/@@images/9562deb1-2d07-4eb7-977e-f0d5dce1848e.jpeg" alt="Plone Conference 2016 " class="image-inline" title="Plone Conference 2016 " /></a></span></p>
<p class=" "><a title="" href="https://plone.com/about" class="internal-link" target="_self">Learn more about Plone...</a></p>
<p class=" "> </p>
<p> </p></div>

</div>


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f775469746c65506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a726563656e742d706c6f6e652d6c61756e63686573" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f775469746c65506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a726563656e742d706c6f6e652d6c61756e63686573"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-recent-plone-launches"><p><img src="https://plone.com/images/2.png" alt="icon for Recent Plone Launches" class="image-inline" title="2.png" /></p>
<h2><span class="title">Recent Plone Launches</span></h2>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://plone.com/success-stories/french-ministry-of-national-education">French Ministry of Education</a><br />By: Makina Corpus<br />Location: France</li>
<li><a href="https://plone.com/success-stories/the-metropolitan-redevelopment-authority">The Metropolitan Redevelopment Authority</a><br />By: Hatchd<br />Location: Australia</li>
<li><a href="https://plone.com/success-stories/the-mountaineers">The Mountaineers</a><br />By: Jazkarta<br />Location: North America</li>
<li><a href="https://plone.com/success-stories/onkopedia">Onkopedia</a><br />By: ZOPYX <br />Location: Germany</li>
<li><a href="https://plone.com/success-stories/denso-auto-parts">Denso Auto Parts</a><br /> By: Syslab<br />Location: Germany</li>
</ul></div>

</div>


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f775469746c65506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a74686972642d706f72746c6574" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f775469746c65506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a74686972642d706f72746c6574"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-they-use-plone"><p><img src="https://plone.com/images/1.png" alt="" class="image-inline" title="" /></p>
<h2><span class="title">THEY USE PLONE</span></h2>
<div style="text-align: center; "><img src="https://plone.com/images/logo-companies-that-use-plone/@@images/befdf4ea-bab4-4abe-8241-ede3295bffac.jpeg" alt="Logos - Companies that use Plone" class="image-inline" title="Logos - Companies that use Plone" /></div>
<p style="text-align: right; "><a title="" href="https://plone.com/about/they-use-plone" class="internal-link" target="_self">see more...</a></p></div>

<div id="portlets-below" class="row">
     
         
             <div class="cell BelowPortletManager1 width-1:2 position-0">


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a656e74657270726973652d696e746567726174696f6e" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a656e74657270726973652d696e746567726174696f6e"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-enterprise-integration"><h2 class="documentDescription">Enterprise Integration</h2>
<p>A true team player, Plone connects and plays well with your existing infrastructure</p></div>

</div>


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a666c657869626c652d776f726b666c6f7773" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a666c657869626c652d776f726b666c6f7773"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-flexible-workflows"><h2 class="documentDescription">Flexible Workflows</h2>
<p>You're in control of how your content is created, shared, and stored</p></div>

</div>


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a696e647573747269616c2d737472656e6774682d7365637572697479" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a696e647573747269616c2d737472656e6774682d7365637572697479"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-industrial-strength-security"><h2 class="documentDescription">Industrial Strength Security</h2>
<p>Rest easy, Plone has the best security track record of any Enterprise Content Management System</p></div>

</div>


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a6c696d69746c6573732d657874656e736962696c697479" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a6c696d69746c6573732d657874656e736962696c697479"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-limitless-extensibility"><h2 class="documentDescription">Limitless Extensibility</h2>
<p>Everything you need to manage, preserve, and deliver information to support your business needs</p>
<p> </p></div>

</div>


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a726f627573742d7363616c6162696c697479" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572310a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a726f627573742d7363616c6162696c697479"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-robust-scalability"><h2 class="documentDescription">Robust Scalability</h2>
<p>Fast and adaptable to your business needs today and 10 years from now</p>
<p> </p></div>

</div>

</div> 

         
         
             <div class="cell BelowPortletManager4 width-1:2 position-1:2">


<div id="portletwrapper-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572340a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a73706f6e736f727368697073" class="portletWrapper kssattr-portlethash-436f6e74656e7457656c6c506f72746c6574732e42656c6f77506f72746c65744d616e61676572340a636f6e746578740a2f706c6f6e65636f6d2f66726f6e742d706167650a73706f6e736f727368697073"><div class="portletStaticText portlet-static-sponsorships"><p>A hearty thank you to our Premium Sponsors! </p>
<p><a class="external-link" href="http://beslist.nl" target="_blank" title="beslist.nl open source program"><img src="https://plone.com/beslist_logo.png/@@images/71297f1f-e354-4008-bfd0-9d910fc3b663.png" alt="beslist.nl open source program" class="image-inline" title="Beslist.nl logo" /></a>  <a class="external-link" href="http://cosent.nl/" target="_blank" title=""><img src="https://plone.com/sponsors/logo3.png" alt="Cosent" class="image-inline" title="Cosent" /></a>  <a class="external-link" href="https://www.wildcardcorp.com/" target="_blank" title=""><img src="https://plone.com/sponsors/wildcard-corp" alt="Wildcard is a small business corporation based in central Wisconsin specializing in providing secure online solutions to both the federal government and private industry.
